title: Aspaldi 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are a touch baked and raisiny, which makes sense given the warmth and dryness of the 2011 vintage in Rioja. On the palate, this is dry as a bone, with cheek-pounding tannins. Flavors of roasted plum, red currant, tomato sauce and vanilla finish raw but also clean and true. Drink through 2024.

title: Ayala NV Rosé Majeur Brut  (Champagne)
description: Chardonnay dominates this wine (its color comes from the addition of still red wine, a normal practice in Champagne). With its mineral texture and low dosage that give a crisp aftertaste, this is a food-friendly rosé. Drink now.

title: Batasiolo 2014 Boscareto  (Barolo)
description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, truffle, leather and game follow over to the firm palate along with dried cherry, prune, crushed herb and clove. Close-grained, drying tannins provide astringent support while it finishes on a rather salty note. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 DOM Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose suggests notes of crushed mineral, pollen and sunbaked slate. Tart tangerine and green plum flavors are pristine and juicy on the palate. It finishes quite dry and refreshing.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2012 Rioja Bordón Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy rooty aromas of licorice, anise, fennel and dried berry fruits are a bit herbal and raw. As for raw, the palate fits that description, with bumpiness to boot. Berry, oak spice and baking-spice flavors are steady on the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2015 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, spicy berry and black-cherry aromas are spread across a concentrated nose. A tight juicy palate is fresh, while this weighs in as medium-to-full. Lightly roasted berry and plum flavors include a spot of oaky vanilla, while this is mellow and emphasizes freshness and spice notes on the finish.

title: Ca' del Baio 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of cedar, dark spice and black-skinned berry lead the nose. The dense palate evokes vanilla, black cherry jam and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Calabria Family Wines 2014 The Iconic Grand Reserve Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: From 100-year-old vines revived by the Calabria family themselves, this is a broody, robust red that needs time in the cellar. Ripe plum and dark berry, dark chocolate, pepper and plenty of charred oak dominate the nose. The palate dials the richness up another notch, coating the tongue like a wool blanket with more plush fruit and toasty, chewy oak. This is a beast of a wine at the moment and needs a few more years to settle. Drink 2020–2038.

title: CarlindePaolo 2015  Barbaresco
description: Delicate aromas of rose petal, tilled soil and leather emerge from the glass. The round palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and vanilla alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Cascina Rabaglio 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark berry, underbrush and botanical herb. The taut palate offers red cherry, white pepper and clove alongside firm acidity and assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Castello d'Alba 2016 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This stylish wine balances acidity with a firm core of tannins. Its berry fruits and spice from wood aging are now integrated to give a ripe wine that also has a fresh juicy element. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Castello di Azeglio 2016  Erbaluce di Caluso
description: Delicately alluring aromas of peach blossom, stone fruit and citrus lead the nose. Recalling the aromas, the ripe, rounded palate offers mature yellow apple, candied tangerine zest and pineapple packed in syrup.

title: Château Favray 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: The Favray estate is one parcel of 39 acres, producing a taut, mineral and citrus-fruit-driven wine. Still young, his potentially rich wine has intense acidity that needs to soften. Drink from 2019.

title: Claude Baron NV Pierre de Lune Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: The luminescence of the moon is reflected in the Baron family's crisp Chardonnay. This taut, dry wine has attractive apple and tight citrus flavors. Its acidity and lively bright texture come together to give a perfumed wine touched by minerality, and ready to drink.
designation: Pierre de Lune Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Héritage Reserve Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: There's a palate-reviving snap to this wine, which opens with ripe, juicy flavors of blackberries. A streak of mocha carries it along, and there's a hint of something akin to eucalyptus as well.

title: Damilano 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of underbrush, exotic spice and dark-skinned fruit mingle with a whiff of camphor. The assertive palate offers dried morello cherry, clove and star anise alongside firm acidity while tightly knit, close-grained tannins leave a somewhat astringent finish. It's still austere and needs time to fully develop. Drink after 2022.

title: Doña Paula 2015 Selección de Bodega Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Blackberry, cassis and licorice aromas are ripe on the nose. Bright acidity creates tension on the palate, while this tastes of berry and cherry flavors offset by lactic oak. On the finish, an oaky vanilla tone wrestles with brisk red-berry acidity.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Vibrant aromas of grapefruit spray, papaya and tomato leaf carry to the textured, light-bodied palate. This is immensely crisp and refreshing in feel, with crunchy green pear and citrus ringing on the finish.

title: Fairsing 2016 Fairsing Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: There's a strong citrus component of lemon and grapefruit, underscoring wild blackberry fruit. Barrel aging for 10 months in 30% new French oak adds a streak of roasted coffee through the finish. Balanced and medium bodied, this should drink well into the mid-2020s.

title: Franchetti 2015 Passobianco Chardonnay (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made with 100% Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of orchard fruit, toasted oak and acacia flower. The rich palate offers Golden Delicious apple and lemon alongside a note of bitter almond. Drink through 2022.
